All 16 static findings are FALSE POSITIVEs: the 'hardcoded URL' is metadata, 'filesystem access' is a URL field, 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns are Japanese/English description text, and 'shell backtick execution' patterns are markdown code block syntax (NOT Ruby/shell execution). content.user_title: Generate Type-Safe API Clients from OpenAPI
content.value_statement: Developers spend hours manually creating API client code and types. This skill automates API client generation from OpenAPI specifications using Orval. It validates the spec, runs Orval to generate TypeScript client code, verifies the output, and confirms type correctness.
actual_capabilities: Validates OpenAPI specification file existence before generation
Runs Orval to generate type-safe TypeScript API client code
Verifies generated API client files are created correctly
Executes TypeScript type checking on generated code
Reports generation results with file paths and status
limitations: Requires pre-configured Orval setup in frontend project
Needs existing api-docs.yaml file in backend resources directory
Only generates clients, does not modify or create API specifications

faq.question: What tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Generates TypeScript clients for any frontend framework.

faq.question: What are the limits on OpenAPI spec size?
faq.answer: Orval handles large specifications. Very large specs may take longer and increase bundle size.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my build process?
faq.answer: Add the generation command to your package.json scripts. Run before development or in CI pipeline.

faq.question: Is my data safe during generation?
faq.answer: Yes. Orval runs locally and only reads the OpenAPI spec file. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Generation failed with type errors. What should I do?
faq.answer: Check that your OpenAPI spec is valid. Ensure backend and frontend TypeScript configs are compatible.

faq.question: How is this different from Swagger Codegen?
faq.answer: Orval generates specifically for TypeScript and React with better type inference and hooks support.
